intro: Hieracium levicaule subsp. calcigenum, commonly known as the limestone hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to calcareous grasslands and rocky soils in Europe. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The plant produces yellow composite flowers in late summer, consisting of numerous small florets arranged in a disc. It has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as meadows and cliffs, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
